Package ohos.bluetooth

Class SppServerSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.bluetooth.SppServerSocket

  • public class SppServerSocket
extends Object
    Provides Serial Port Profile (SPP) server sockets.

    The SPP socket interface has two roles: SppServerSocket and SppClientSocket. To create an SppServerSocket, use DataListenSocket to create a listening SPP server. When a connection is accepted by SppServerSocket, it returns a new SppClientSocket for data transmission.

    The most common transmission channel of SPP is RFCOMM, which is established by Bluetooth BR/EDR. To create an RFCOMM SPP in traditional Bluetooth, use DataListenSocket#dataListenRfcomm or DataListenSocket#dataListenInsecureRfcomm. The server listens for a new BR/EDR connection.

    After an SppClientSocket instance is created, call accept() to allow for a new remote connection. An SppClientSocket will be returned, from which you can obtain InputStream or OutputStream to read and write data.

    Since:
    7

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public SppClientSocket accept​()
                       throws IOException
        Waits for a remote device to connect to the SppServerSocket.

        This method can be used to wait for a new connection to the SppServerSocket. If the remote device uses the connection mode in DataListenSocket, an SppClientSocket is returned, which can be used to read data from and write data into streams.

        Returns:
        Returns the SppClientSocket, which can be used to obtain the input and output streams.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if this call was aborted.
        Since:
        7

      • close

        public void close​()
           throws IOException
        Disables an SppServerSocket and releases related resources.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the SppServerSocket fails to be disabled.
        Since:
        7
